intro: Acinodendron divergens, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and spiny, compound leaves. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
